Class Drive

java.lang.Object
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
frc.robot.subsystems.Drive
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
public class Drive extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
The subsystem that represents the drivetrain.

  • Method Details

    • driveRobot

      public void driveRobot(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d translation, double z, boolean isFieldOriented)
      Drives the robot in either field relative or robot relative.
      Parameters:
      translation - Translation2d that represents the commanded robot velocities on the x and y axes. Front-left positive. Relative to the field.
      z - Robot angular velocity around the z-axis in radians per second. Counter-clockwise is positive.
      isFieldOriented - If the robot should either drive field oriented or robot oriented.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops all motors in the subsystem.

    • enterXMode

      public void enterXMode()
      Points the wheels toward the inside and stops the wheels from moving in any direction.

    • zeroGyro

      public void zeroGyro()
      Zeroes the NavX gyro. Mostly used for resetting the angle for field-oriented drive (for now).

      Somewhat notably, this will also reset odometry to the same position it's currently at, but facing towards zero.

    • getMaximumSpeed

      public double getMaximumSpeed()
      Gets the maximum speed the robot chassis can achieve in m/s.
      Returns:
      Maximum speed the robot chassis can achieve in m/s.

    • getMaximumAngularSpeed

      public double getMaximumAngularSpeed()
      Gets the maximum angular speed the robot chassis can achieve in rad/s.
      Returns:
      Maximum angular speed the robot chassis can achieve in rad/s.

    • setHeadingCorrection

      public void setHeadingCorrection(boolean state)
      Set the heading correction capabilities of YAGSL. Should only be enabled when heading correction capabilities are in use
      Parameters:
      state - SwerveDrive.headingCorrection state

    • getTargetSpeeds

      public edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds getTargetSpeeds(double translationX, double translationY, double headingX, double headingY)
      Takes [-1, 1] joystick-like inputs and converts them to a ChassisSpeeds object that represents the commanded robot velocities
      Parameters:
      translationX - joystick input for the left to right axis. [-1, 1], left is positive.
      translationY - joystick input for the forward to backward axis. [-1, 1], forward is positive.
      headingX - x component of the cartesian angle of the robot's heading
      headingY - y component of the cartesian angle of the robot's heading
      Returns:
      ChassisSpeeds object that represents the commanded robot velocities

    • setDriveMode

      public void setDriveMode(String driveMode)
      Sets the drive mode in SmartDashboard.

      THIS DOES NOT SET THE ROBOT'S DRIVE MODE

      Parameters:
      driveMode - The mode to display in SmartDashboard.

    • getHeading

      public edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d getHeading()
      Returns the heading of the robot.
      Returns:
      The heading of the robot.

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Runs every scheduler run.
